uk.name: United Kingdom
uk.heroDescription: Globally recognised degrees, world-class universities, and strong post-study work opportunities.
uk.whyStudy: The UK offers academic excellence, industry-aligned education, and global career recognition. Home to some of the world's oldest and most prestigious institutions, UK degrees are valued by employers worldwide.
uk.description: The United Kingdom is one of the world's leading education destinations, offering a rich academic heritage combined with modern innovation.

visa.duration: Duration of course + 4-6 months grace period
visa.description: UK Student Visa with Graduate Route post-study work rights.
requirements: Offer letter from recognised UK institution
Proof of financial support (Â£40,000+ per year)

workRights.duringStudies: Up to 20 hours per week during term time, full-time during official holidays
workRights.postStudies: Graduate Route: 2 years post-study work right for Bachelor's/Master's graduates, 3 years for PhD graduates
workRights.restrictions: No self-employment or professional sports during studies
workRights.description: Generous work rights for skill development and career building

tuitionFees.international: Â£15,000 - Â£40,000+ per year (varies by course and university)

highlights: Shortest course durations in Western world (1-2 years for Master's)
Rich cultural heritage and modern innovation
Post-study work rights with Graduate Route
uk.climate: Temperate maritime climate - mild winters and cool summers, frequent rainfall

bestCities.name: London
bestCities.description: Global financial hub, cultural centre, best job opportunities

bestCities.name: Edinburgh
bestCities.description: Historic city, vibrant culture, lower living costs

bestCities.name: Manchester
bestCities.description: Growing tech hub, affordable, strong universities

bestCities.name: Oxford/Cambridge
bestCities.description: Ancient academic institutions, tight-knit communities

applicationProcess: Step 1: Research universities and programs (6-12 months before intake)
Step 2: Prepare documents (transcripts, essays, references)
Step 3: Submit applications via UCAS (for undergraduates) or directly to university (postgraduates)
Step 4: Attend interviews (for competitive programs)
Step 5: Receive offer letter (Conditional or Unconditional)
Step 6: Secure CAS (Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies)
Step 7: Apply for Student Visa
Step 8: Arrange accommodation and travel
whyPremassUK: Expert guidance on UK application process
Guaranteed admission support with high success rate

usa.name: United States
usa.heroDescription: Flexible education system, cutting-edge research, and global career exposure.
usa.whyStudy: The USA provides innovation-driven education and extensive post-study work options. With diverse educational institutions and strong ties to the global economy, US degrees open doors worldwide.
usa.description: The United States offers the world's largest education system with endless possibilities for academic specialization and career advancement.

phd.description: Research-based doctoral programs (fully funded in many cases)

visa.description: F-1 Student Visa with Optional Practical Training (OPT) and CPT opportunities.
visa.processTime: Immediate after I-20 approval + 2-4 weeks visa interview scheduling
requirements: Proof of financial support ($40,000-80,000+ per year)

workRights.duringStudies: On-campus: Up to 20 hours/week during school term, full-time during breaks; Off-campus: CPT (Curriculum Practical Training) and internships with permission
workRights.postStudies: OPT (Optional Practical Training): 12 months standard, 24 months extension for STEM fields; Total up to 36 months for STEM graduates
workRights.restrictions: Must be enrolled and maintain valid status
workRights.description: Extensive practical training opportunities with strong work experience benefits

livingCosts.total: $1,400 - $2,650 per month (varies by location and city)

scholarships: Fulbright Scholarship - Full funding for select countries
highlights: Flexible curriculum with electives and specializations
Strong industry connections and internship opportunities
Extended OPT work rights for STEM graduates
Extensive career services and alumni networks

jobMarket.averageSalary: $55,000 - $85,000 starting (highly variable by field and location)

usa.climate: Varies widely - tropical (Hawaii/Florida), temperate (Northeast/Midwest), arid (Southwest), temperate oceanic (West Coast)

bestCities.name: San Francisco/Silicon Valley
bestCities.description: Tech hub, startup culture, innovation centre

bestCities.name: New York
bestCities.description: Financial hub, cultural diversity, career opportunities

bestCities.name: Boston
bestCities.description: Education hub, research opportunities, multiple universities

bestCities.name: Austin
bestCities.description: Emerging tech hub, lower costs, vibrant culture

applicationProcess: Step 1: Identify universities and programs (1 year before intended enrollment)
Step 2: Prepare test scores (GRE, GMAT, TOEFL/IELTS)
Step 3: Gather documents (transcripts, essays, letters of recommendation)
Step 4: Submit applications online via Common App or university portals
Step 5: Interview (if required) via video or in-person
Step 6: Receive admission decision and financial aid package
Step 7: Submit I-20 form request to university
Step 8: Apply for F-1 visa at US embassy/consulate
Step 9: Complete SEVIS registration
Step 10: Arrange accommodation and travel
whyPremassUSA: Partnerships with 200+ US universities across tiers
Expert GRE/GMAT coaching and test prep guidance
Strong track record with Ivy League and top-tier schools
F-1 visa process expertise with high approval rates
Financial aid and scholarship identification support
Alumni network access and career mentoring

canada.name: Canada
canada.heroDescription: Affordable education with high visa success and clear PR pathways.
canada.whyStudy: Canada offers quality education with long-term settlement opportunities. Known for being welcoming to international students and offering a pathway to permanent residency.
canada.description: Canada is a top education destination combining world-class universities with affordable living costs and attractive immigration pathways.
canada.tagline: Quality Education, Affordability & Clear PR Pathways

diploma.description: Career-focused diploma programs (very popular path to PR)

visa.duration: Duration of study + 6 months grace period
visa.description: Canadian Study Permit with clear pathway to Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP).
requirements: Letter of Acceptance from DLI (Designated Learning Institution)

workRights.duringStudies: Up to 20 hours per week during school term (must attend school at least 50% of the time), full-time during official holidays
workRights.postStudies: Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP): Valid up to 3 years (based on study duration). Can lead to permanent residency application.
workRights.restrictions: Must be enrolled in eligible program at DLI
workRights.description: Excellent pathway to permanent residency through work experience and PR programs

tuitionFees.international: CAD 15,000 - 45,000+ per year (varies by province and institution)

livingCosts.total: CAD 1,300 - 2,420 per month (varies by city - Toronto/Vancouver costlier)

scholarships: Government of Canada scholarships for developing countries
highlights: More affordable than US and UK for international students
Clear pathway to permanent residency through Express Entry
Two-year Post-Graduation Work Permit for 2-year programs
Strong universities with excellent research facilities
Universal healthcare coverage for international students
Clean environment and high quality of life
canada.climate: Varies by region - cold winters in most areas (-10 to -40Â°C), mild on coasts, temperate in southern regions

bestCities.name: Toronto
bestCities.description: Largest city, diverse economy, financial hub, most jobs

bestCities.name: Vancouver
bestCities.description: Mild climate, natural beauty, growing tech hub

bestCities.name: Waterloo
bestCities.description: Tech innovation hub, startup culture, growing economy

bestCities.name: Calgary
bestCities.description: Affordable, energy sector jobs, outdoor recreation

permanentResidencyPathway: Step 1: Complete study program in Canada (at least 2 years)
Step 2: Work on Post-Graduation Work Permit (up to 3 years available)
Step 3: Gain Canadian work experience (usually 1 year minimum required)
Step 4: Apply for PR through Express Entry (Canadian Experience Class or Federal Skilled Worker)
Step 5: PR approval and settlement in Canada
Timeline: Total 3-5 years from study completion to PR
applicationProcess: Step 1: Choose province and institution (1 year before enrollment)
Step 2: Prepare documents (transcripts, test scores, letters)
Step 3: Submit applications to DLI institutions
Step 4: Receive Letter of Acceptance
Step 5: Gather financial documents (bank statements, proof of funds)
Step 6: Apply for Study Permit online (AIP application)
Step 7: Complete medical exam if requested
Step 8: Receive Study Permit approval
Step 9: Arrange accommodation and travel
whyPremassCanada: Expert knowledge of Canadian PR pathways
Study Permit application support with high approval rates
Province selection guidance based on goals
Guidance on choosing programs aligned with in-demand occupations
PGWP and Express Entry pathway counselling
Career planning aligned with PR requirements

australia.name: Australia
australia.heroDescription: Globally ranked universities, high lifestyle quality, and strong post-study employment options.
australia.whyStudy: Australia offers world-class education with excellent employment prospects and lifestyle quality. Known for practical learning approaches and strong industry connections.
australia.description: Australia is a premier education destination combining academic excellence with lifestyle quality and clear pathways to skilled migration.

bachelor.description: Undergraduate degree (Bachelor of Science, Arts, Commerce, etc.)

vocationaldiploma.description: VET (Vocational Education & Training) programs - popular and practical

visa.duration: Duration of study + 5 months or up to validity date of final semester
visa.description: Australian Student Visa with post-study work rights (Skilled Independent Visa pathway).
requirements: Conditional or Unconditional Letter of Offer
Proof of financial support (AUD 20,000-25,000 per year)
English language proficiency (IELTS 5.5+ depending on program)

workRights.duringStudies: Up to 20 hours per week during teaching period, unlimited hours during official school holidays
workRights.postStudies: Post-Study Work Visa (subclass 485): 18 months (Bachelor), 2 years (Master's), 3 years (PhD). Can apply for skilled migration visas after.
workRights.restrictions: Must be enrolled and making satisfactory academic progress
workRights.description: Excellent work rights and clear pathway to skilled migration and permanent residency

tuitionFees.international: AUD 20,000 - 50,000+ per year (varies by field and university)

highlights: Excellent student amenities and support services
High quality of life and safety
australia.climate: Varies by region - subtropical (Brisbane), temperate (Sydney/Melbourne), tropical (Far North), arid (outback). Generally warm year-round.

bestCities.name: Sydney
bestCities.description: Largest city, iconic beaches, vibrant culture, most opportunities

bestCities.name: Melbourne
bestCities.description: Cultural hub, arts scene, diverse population, good job market

bestCities.name: Brisbane
bestCities.description: Growing economy, lower costs, sunny climate, outdoor lifestyle

bestCities.name: Perth
bestCities.description: Isolated but vibrant, lowest costs, booming resources sector

permanentResidencyPathway: Step 1: Complete study in Australia (minimum 2 years)
Step 2: Work on Post-Study Work Visa (18 months to 3 years)
Step 3: Work in occupations on skilled migration list (typically 1-2 years)
Step 4: Apply for permanent residency via Skilled Independent Visa (189) or Employer-Sponsored Visa (186)
Timeline: Total 4-6 years from study completion to PR
applicationProcess: Step 1: Research universities and programs (6-12 months before intake)
Step 2: Prepare documents (transcripts, test scores, portfolio if needed)
Step 3: Submit applications directly to universities
Step 4: Receive Letter of Offer
Step 5: Confirm enrollment and pay deposit
Step 6: Receive Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE)
Step 7: Apply for Student Visa online via ImmiAccount
Step 8: Complete medical examination and police checks
Step 9: Visa approval and travel arrangement
whyPremassAustralia: Direct partnerships with Go8 and other top Australian universities
Skilled migration pathway planning and guidance
State sponsorship and employer sponsorship knowledge
Career planning aligned with migration goals

europe.name: Europe
europe.heroDescription: Affordable education, English-taught programs, cultural diversity, and global perspectives.
europe.whyStudy: Europe offers high-quality education at a fraction of the cost compared to US/UK, with unique cultural experiences and strong industries.
europe.description: Europe provides diverse education options across multiple countries with affordable tuition, excellent research facilities, and rich cultural experiences.

workRights.postStudies: Varies: Netherlands (1 year), Germany (18 months), France (12 months post-graduation. Many have pathways to long-term visa post-study.
workRights.restrictions: Must not exceed limits specified by country
